summary: tumor microenvironment promotes tumor growth, stimulates angiogenesis, increases inflammatory response and induces metastasis (1–4) mouse models of human cancer play a crucial role in cancer research and the screening of anticancer agents (5,6) HB and SUB mouse models were established, and orthotopic tumor cells were obtained from orthotopic tumor masses by primary culture. differentially expressed genes were validated by reverse transcription-quantitative polymerase chain reaction (RT-qPCR) the humanized HB models were obtained in may 2013 from elective breast reduction mammoplasty surgery of 3 patients at the The First Affliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University. sample collection was performed in accordance with the Declaration of Helsinki (14), and approved by the Ethics and Research Committee of the First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University. the cells were harvested with 0.25% tyrosine and 0.02% disodium EDTA. human breast cancer cells (5105) in 0.2 ml PBS were injected into the implanted human breast tissues 1 week after implantation of the human breast tissue. the primary cultured human breast cancer cells were finally obtained. RNA extraction Total RNA was isolated from primary cells. RNA concentrations and the A260 nm/A280 nm ratio were assessed using a nanodrop 1000 spectrophotometer. reactions were performed on the Eppendorf MasterCycler RealPlex. thermal cycling conditions consisted of 10 min at 95°C and 40 cycles of 10 sec denaturation at 95°C, 15 sec annealing at 58°C, and 45 sec extension at 72°C. the primer sequences for RT-qPCR are listed in Table I. t-test was used to screen differential genes in the microarray. human breast cancer SUM1315 cells were labeled with green fluorescent protein (GFP) as previously described (13) animals female severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID) CB-17IcrCrl-scidbgBR mice aged 4–6 weeks were purchased from the Model Animal Research Center of Nanjing University (nanjing, Jiangsu, China) the mice were kept under specific pathogen-free, temperature-controlled conditions. human breast cancer cells were cultured in fresh DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS and 1% penicillin-streptomycin solution. the cells were harvested with 0.25% tyrosine and 0.02% disodium EDTA (Gibco; Thermo Fisher Scientific, Inc.) the samples were centrifuged at 129 g for 5 min in a centrifuge. subsequent to discarding the supernatant, the sedimentary tumor pieces were re-suspended in 5 ml DMEM. another 10 ml DMEM was added into the dishes for routine cell culture 16 h later. 500 ng of total RNA was amplified and biotin-labeled with the Ambion Illumina® total prep RNA Amplification kit. Labeled cRNAs were hybridized to the Illumina HumanHT-12 V4 expression BeadChip (Illumina, Inc.) and imaged using an Iscan system. RT-qPCR was used to verify the gene expression profile results. Sense CGTAACTGGCGGAAACCC Antisense TTGGAGGAAACATTGTGAGC BCL10 234 Sense CCGAGGAGGACCTCACT Antisense GAATAGATTCAACAAGGGTGT LRTM1 113 Sense CCAGGAGGACCTCTCACT Antisense GGAAGGGTTTCGGCCAGA BPTF 208 Sense CCAGTGTGTGTACGATGA Antisense TGCAGGAACC SH3BP5, SH t-test was used to screen differential genes in the microarray. P0.05 was considered to indicate a statistically significant difference. human breast cancer SUM1315 cell line was provided by Dr Stephen Ethier. breast tissues were sliced under sterile conditions into pieces 44x4 mm in size. three pieces were selected randomly for histological examination. small pieces of the human breast tissues were placed in ice-cold PBS. primary cultured tumor cells All mice were sacrificed 5 weeks after implantation. orthotopic tumor masses were collected under sterile conditions. sections of the orthotopic tumor masses were washed in sterile PBS. RNA concentrations and the A260 nm/A280 nm ratio were assessed using a nanodrop 1000 spectrophotometer. 500 ng of total RNA was amplified and biotin-labeled. labeled cRNAs were hybridized to the Illumina HumanHT-12 V4 expression BeadChip (Illumina, Inc.) the primer sequences for RT-qPCR are listed in Table I. mRNA quantities were analyzed in triplicate and normalized against -actin as a control gene. RT-qPCR confirmed the differential expression of 8 genes, with only 2 genes not demonstrating differential expression. in vitro models do not recapitulate all dynamics and dimensions of the tissue. in vitro models do not fully recapitulate all dynamics and dimensions of the tissue. the novel mouse model and microarray technology was used to analyze the gene expression changes in breast cancer cells regulated by the human mammary microenvironment. the expression levels of 94 identified genes were modulated by the human mammary microenvironment. genes that promote cell proliferation and metastasis were upregulated in the pri-HB-1315 group. pathophysiological processes (41), but not tumor progression. the mapping of genes to GO nodes is a powerful functional genomics tool. the term definition and details were acquired from the GO network (42). some efforts have already been made in implanting human immune tissues or cells into immunodeficient mouse models (43–45). HB mouse model is not able to absolutely mimic all species-specific interactions between human breast cancer cells and the human mammary microenvironment.
